text: Personal Injury When you have suffered a serious, life-altering injury or a loved one has died in a car, truck, or motorcycle accident, you need a compassionate personal injury attorney with the experience to take on big insurance companies and get you the compensation you need to recover. For almost 50 years, Skeeters, Bennett, Wilson & Humphrey has been fighting for your neighbors in Central Kentucky in personal injury law, and we can be here for you at this low point in your life. Reach out to us today to find out how we might be able to serve you. Estate Planning & Elder Law Estate planning involves more than just writing a will. A comprehensive estate plan makes your wishes clear, protects your assets, helps your family, and grants legal authority to a trusted representative to make decisions on your behalf in case you become incapacitated. In other words, it gives you peace of mind in the face of life’s unexpected events. Whether you need to revise your estate plan because you have experienced a major life event such as marriage or the birth of a child, or you need to create one from scratch, our team can explain which documents and tools will accomplish your goals and guide you through the process. Contact Skeeters, Bennett, Wilson & Humphrey in Radcliff today. Probate & Estate When a person dies and leaves behind an estate, at least part of it will probably have to pass through Kentucky probate court before assets are distributed to heirs. Steps must be taken almost immediately after the death to secure the estate and begin the probate process. This can be very difficult in the aftermath of losing a cherished family member. The probate team at Skeeters, Bennett, Wilson & Humphrey understands the challenging and delicate nature of dealing with a deceased person’s estate. Your entire family will benefit from the services of a probate professional. Reach out to our law office in Radcliff to learn more about what we do to assist with Kentucky probate. Wills A will is one of the most important legal documents you'll ever create, yet many people put off this critical task or attempt to handle it themselves with online templates. Without a properly executed will, Kentucky law—not your wishes—determines who inherits your property and who cares for your minor children. Our experienced Radcliff will attorneys help Central Kentucky families draft legal documents that protect their loved ones, preserve their legacies, and provide peace of mind for the future.
